conclusion: Determine if the two objects have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \) by analyzing velocity-time graphs.

The image shows two velocity-time graphs for Object A and Object B, starting at the origin. Object A's graph is a parabola, Object B's graph is a straight line. Time points \( t_1, t_2, t_3, t_4 \) are marked.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, calculated as the slope of the tangent to the velocity-time graph.
For Object A, the slope of the tangent to the parabola at \( t_1 \) represents the acceleration.
For Object B, the slope of the tangent to the straight line at \( t_1 \) represents the acceleration.
Compare the slopes of the tangents at \( t_1 \) for both objects to determine if accelerations are the same.
The slope of the tangent at \( t_1 \) for both objects is the same, so the acceleration is the same.
